overview.problemStatement: Is there some function f(n)→∞" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">f(n)→∞f(n)→∞f(n)\to \infty as n→∞" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">n→∞n→∞n\to\infty such that there exist n" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">nnn distinct points on the surface of a two-dimensional sphere with at least f(n)n" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">f(n)nf(n)nf(n)n many pairs of points whose distances are the same?
